instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00850: What is 820-00850? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V3_G3H: What is PP3V3_G3H? PP3V3_G3H is a 3.3v power line that is present when the machine is in a Global System Hardware Off state, and should come on before most other rails so that the USB-C circuitry can be powered for the charger.
definitions.PP5V_G3S: What is PP5V_G3S? PP5V_G3S is a 5v power rail present when the system is in a G3S standby state.
definitions.PP0V9_SSD0: What is PP0V9_SSD0? This is a power rail for the soldered on SSD on newer Macbooks. .
definitions.PP1V8_SSD0: What is PP1V8_SSD0? PP1V8_SSD0 is a power rail responsible for powering the soldered on NAND memory for the SSD on newer Macbook Pros.
definitions.PP1V2_S3: What is PP1V2_S3? PP1V2_S3 is a 1.2v power rail present when the machine is in an S3 suspend to RAM state.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 20v 0.04a
threads.message:
No history available.

Tried restoring T2 firmware under catalina and big sur but same problem

Checked for shorts on all rails and found nothing.

<SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL>: 3.3V
<SIGNAL>PP5V_G3S</SIGNAL>: 5V
PPBUS: 12.62V
<SIGNAL>PP0V9_SSD0</SIGNAL>: 0.9V
<SIGNAL>PP1V8_SSD0</SIGNAL>: 1.8V
<SIGNAL>PP2V7_NAND0</SIGNAL>: 2.5V* not sure if this is a problem

<SIGNAL>CPUVR_SWSA</SIGNAL>: 0V
<SIGNAL>PVCCIO_PHASE</SIGNAL>: 0V
<SIGNAL>P1V2_PHASE</SIGNAL>: 0V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 20v 0.04a
threads.message:
So DFU completes correctly?

I suppose you don't get VCORE and VCCSA, apart of VCCIO.
1V2 for RAM must appear before.
Post <CHIP>U8100</CHIP> basic voltages; pins 12, 16, 17, 6.

BTW, STOP to check voltages in the AC side of a coil; ALWAYS check on its output (DC side), where the filter cap is placed.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 20v 0.04a
threads.message:
DFU fails, I tried on both Catalina and Big Sur.

<CHIP>U8100</CHIP>:1 <SIGNAL>PP1V2_S3</SIGNAL> 0V Not shorted
<CHIP>U8100</CHIP>:12 <SIGNAL>PP5V_EDRAM_V5IN</SIGNAL> 5V
<CHIP>U8100</CHIP>:16 <SIGNAL>PVDDQ_EN_R</SIGNAL> 0V Not shorted
<CHIP>U8100</CHIP>:17 <SIGNAL>MEMVTT_EN_R</SIGNAL> 0V Not shorted
<CHIP>U8100</CHIP>:6 <SIGNAL>P1V2REG_VREF</SIGNAL> 0V Not shorted

Thanks for the heads up, I will do that from now on.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 20v 0.04a
threads.message:
<CHIP>U7800</CHIP> doesn't send out <SIGNAL>PVDDQ_EN</SIGNAL> for some reason.
Maybe missing previous voltage rail, or power good signal.

Machine is recognized in DFU, but cannot complete restore, nor revive options?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 20v 0.04a
threads.message:
Reballed and checked <CHIP>U7800</CHIP> but <SIGNAL>PVDDQ_EN</SIGNAL> is still 0V.

Machine is recognized in DFU, but cannot restore nor revive in neither Catalina nor Big Sur.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 20v 0.04a
threads.message:
Did you check if other previous voltages expected by <CHIP>U7800</CHIP> are present?
We have posted on the forum two power on diagrams for T2 machines.
Are from different boards, but still help.
